concept.title: What's new in version 1.2.0.3
concept.shortdesc: Learn about the new features in version 1.2.0.3

dlentry.dd:
You can use the Protocol Plug-in SDK to extend protocol support beyond the protocols that are natively supported. Use the SDK to write Java plug-ins that you can then deploy in . The protocol plug-in feature allows you to:
Create custom HTTP-based protocols that use the HTTP server, which handles large numbers of connections.
Add industry-specific or device-specific protocols while still using network connections that handle large numbers of connections.
Publish messages that can be received by any protocol.
Subscribe to messages that are published by any protocol.
For more information about developing a protocol plug-in, see .

In addition to CA certificates, now accepts individual client certificates. Applications can now connect and authenticate by using their own certificates. For more information about configuring client certificates, see .
